epitaph.value: So long, and thanks for all the cheese

sentence.value: we all have our little solipsistic delusions
ghastly intuitions of utter singularity
that we are the only one in the house
who ever fills the ice-cube tray
who unloads the clean dishwasher
who occasionally pees in the shower
whose eyelid twitches on first dates
that only we take casualness terribly seriously
that only we fashion supplication into courtesy
that only we hear the whiny pathos in a dog’s yawn
the timeless sigh in the opening
of the hermetically-sealed jar
the splattered laugh in the frying egg
the minor-D lament in the vacuum’s scream
that only we feel the panic at sunset
the rookie kindergartner feels at his mother’s retreat
That only we love the only-we
That only we need the only-we
Solipsism binds us together, J.D. knows
That we feel lonely in a crowd
stop not to dwell on what’s brought the crowd into being
That we are, always, faces in a crowd
